knimeNode.name: Data Explorer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Data Explorer is a exploration tool that allows having an overview on the data and its properties. Exploring the interactive view the node intends to brings the insights and the understanding of the data.

fullDescription.intro:
The node presents the information about the data to explore. It consists of three tabs: statistical, nominal and preview. The statistical and nominal tabs sum up the information on each column, and given the information a user can decide in the interactive view which columns to include in the further analysis or exclude.
Statistical tab shows main statistical parameters of the numerical data, such as minimum, maximum, mean, median (optional) standard deviation, variance, skewness, kurtosis, overall sum, number of zero values, number of missing values, number of not an object values, and positive and negative infinity values. For each column the node also calculates the histogram of value distribution.
Nominal tabprovides an overview on the characteristics of the nominal values, providing the number of missing values, unique values, and top N most frequent and infrequent values. Additionally, each data column has a histogram that shows the frequencies of all values used in a data column.
Data Preview tabshows first several rows of the studying dataset and the values it contains.
